definition: lit. after rain, the spring bamboo (idiom); fig. rapid new growth/many new things emerge in rapid succession
springtime bamboo shoots/fig. (of woman's fingers) tender and delicate
winter bamboo shoots (smaller and tenderer as a result of being dug out before they come out of the soil)
edible stem of Manchurian wild rice 菰[gu1], aka water bamboo

sentences.english: Potassium content in shooting is the greatest and in root and stem (more than two years old) the lowest;
sentences.chinese: 筍是含鉀量最高的器官，地下莖和二年以上的稈最低。

sentences.english: Lei bamboo is a good bamboo species used for bamboo shoots.
sentences.chinese: 雷竹是一種優良的筍用竹種。

sentences.english: They loved it, especially the bamboo and noodles.
sentences.chinese: 他們非常喜歡火鍋，尤其是那裏的筍和麪。

sentences.english: Packed Boiled Bamboo Shoots with kinds of specifications and packages.
sentences.chinese: 小包裝水煮筍，各種規格，包裝。

sentences.english: Atlast, somesuggestionsonthe sustainable development of bamboo shoot industry were raised.
sentences.chinese: 最後，就浙江省筍產業的可持續發展提出了幾點建議。

sentences.english: Boil 3 cups of water , add salt and sugar , poach asparagus.
sentences.chinese: 將3杯水煮沸後加鹽及糖，將露筍烚熟。

definition: a hoe/to hoe or dig/to weed/to get rid of
enclosing frame made of bamboo, wire etc/cage/basket/steamer basket/to cover/to cage/to embrace/to manipulate through trickery
ridge between fields/row of crops/grave mound
